Posts.Title: Tumor Markers Down!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! mommyx3 EmilyInOntario

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2010 09:32PM KGBinDC wrote: Hey everyone, I'm sorry I haven't kept up with this post.  I have had positive experiences and am still working towards that.  My third treatment was last Fri and it hasn't been a day at the beach but I did go to chemo dressed like Holly Go Lightly.  I got cut back on steroids since they wired me out the first couple of times and may be having side effects because of that.  Really bad metal mouth.  But I always see the bright side of it.  I went to Whole Foods to find something organic to take away the taste.  The general manager saw me looking around and asked if I needed help.  When I explained what I was looking for, he took me to the candy aisle and got a bag of "Pomegranate Puckers", put a sticker on them and told me it was a gift.  And they are working!  So I was down for a minute but have been raised back up again.   Btw, my hair is gone but I have now realized that I look a lot better without bangs.  Last one is right around the corner and I plan on going in on the back of a Harley wearing a pink Britney wig.  :)  I hope this helps, I have to say I was scared from reading some of the TC posts too, so I wanted to get the good out.
Posts.Title: TC Chemo really not bad so far KGBinDC KGBinDC

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2010 09:25PM - edited Jun 30, 2010 09:34PM by KGBinDC drim: Thanks!   When my bother shaved my head for me he told me, "Holy ---, I think you look younger without hair."  No lie.  It sounds like we started at the same time and will finish around the same time as well.  My last one is 16 July.  And I'm going in wearing a pink britney wig.  I will probably never be able to get away with it again in my life so I'm going for it! lol.    Water is key!  Keep pushing fluids.  I think I must be the only one that hasn't had any kind of antibiotics or neulasta.  Doc has not even mentioned it.  I take my decadron a day before, the day of and the day after.  I'm wired like a kite but its a wired I am familiar with.  I have zofran for a couple of days after and that's it.  With that said, my blood cell counts have all been normal.  And the weekend before I went to my 3rd round I went to spin class and hot yoga.  I am so happy to hear positive stories.  I hope this string alleviates some of the fears of other women.  Hope everyone has a great 4th of July weekend!!!!
Posts.Title: TC Chemo really not bad so far KGBinDC KGBinDC

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2010 09:36PM KGBinDC wrote: I'm heading into the last one on Fri but not without a little hiccup on the way.  I contracted a lovely sinus infection last week.  I went to my onc immediately and got a Z pac.  My blood counts were all still good so everything is a go as planned for Fri except I am going in with a pink wig and the remnants of this cold.  Yuck.  I sound like typhoid mary.  Still determined to go in smiling and treat this like the last leg of a marathon.
Posts.Title: TC Chemo really not bad so far KGBinDC KGBinDC
TC Chemo really not bad so far KGBinDC KGBinDC

Posts.Content: KGBinDC wrote: Not sure if anyone is having the same experience as I am so I thought I'd share.  I had my first Taxotere/Cytoxan treatment on 14 May 2010.  This Friday is my next my treatment.  I have kept busy and stayed active the whole month.  I drank a lot of water the day before and week after.  I haven't had any weight gain.  My hair did fall out and my brother shaved my head last Fri.  To my suprise everyone thinks I look better without hair.  How wierd is that?  I had some metallic taste in my mouth which killed the taste of champagne.  I have a very lean protein diet and eat a lot of berries.  I also let myself have a frozen chocolate every day.  I'm going to my next treatment with a beach theme.  Beach towel, beach ball, sand pail.  Chemo is just another day at the beach.  I wore Mardi Gras beads to my first treatment.  I think I'll do Breakfast at Tiffany's for the third.  I'm wondering if anyone else has had the same kind of experience?  Dx 2/22/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: TC Chemo really not bad so far KGBinDC KGBinDC

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2010 08:43PM KGBinDC wrote: Drim and Renrel:  Thanks gals, this is the one time I could use a little support and I really appreciate the wishes!  Drim:  I feel like we have been on the same path the whole time.  Good luck tomorrow.  I know what you mean about the steriods.  But the alternative is not good.  My doc cut me back last time to only one, twice a day.  Wasn't tired but queasy.  Lost some weight and then gained it back and a couple pounds this week.  But it really is my fault, I went a little crazy and indulged while my brother (my live-in trainer) was gone.  Back to eating turkey, veggies, egg whites and fruit. I will be right behind you starting Thursday!   Can't believe you got your period!!  So much for getting a break.   Please keep up and let's finish this thing together!  Kimberly
Posts.Title: TC Chemo really not bad so far KGBinDC KGBinDC

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2010 09:34PM KGBinDC wrote: For cmz in Arlington, my Oncotype score was 20.  If it was 18 or below I might not be doing this but in the end I am glad that I did.

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2010 02:02PM KGBinDC wrote: Does anyone ever feel like they are an experiment??  Just Kidding. DancerMel28:  Glad to hear you are done!  Are you doing any follow on hormonal therapy?  Would be interested to know how long they wait to start that up.  I'm having an operation to remove the some skin and to remove the left breast and replace with implant.  (No reason except that I want them to match)  I think I will start the Tamoxifen after operation in Aug but not sure.

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2010 08:04AM KGBinDC wrote: Just about done.  Yesterday was rough with some queasiness and stomach issues.  But I can see the champagne at the end of the week.  Just a few more days to kick the zofran out.  Yesterday was last days of steriods (yay!).  Hopefully a couple of nights of good sleep ahead.  BTW I posted my pictures from chemo here yesterday.  http://community.breastcancer.org/forum/69/topic/755495?page=1#idx_7 Now for just on more operation in Aug to remove some skin on my left breast to get a masctectomy with immediate single step implant on the right one.  After that its all down hill and time to get back to life, not that we ever really leave it because we are strong!
Posts.Title: TC Chemo really not bad so far KGBinDC KGBinDC
